meanings.definition: Not easily bent or changed in shape
meanings.sent1: The cardboard became stiffer after it dried in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The old book's pages were stiffer than the new one's.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fold the stiffer paper was like trying to fold a rock.
meanings.sent4: His resolve was as stiffer than steel, unwavering in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The winter air made her fingers feel stiffer than icicles.

meanings.definition: A person who is strict or severe in behavior
meanings.sent1: The teacher was known as the stiffer in the school, enforcing rules strictly.
meanings.sent2: The stiffer in the office never allowed any leniency in deadlines.
meanings.sent3: The stiffer at the party made sure everyone followed the dress code.
meanings.sent4: She was a stiffer when it came to punctuality, never tolerating lateness.
meanings.sent5: The stiffer's presence made the room feel tense and rigid.

meanings.definition: A person who is dead or no longer alive
meanings.sent1: The cemetery was filled with the stiffers of generations past.
meanings.sent2: The old mansion was said to be haunted by the stiffers of its former residents.
meanings.sent3: The ghostly stiffers gathered around the campfire, sharing tales of the afterlife.
meanings.sent4: Legends spoke of a cursed ship that carried the stiffers of lost sailors.
meanings.sent5: The town's folklore was rich with stories of the stiffers who roamed the streets at night.
